# Description

Liz has a master's degree in astrophysics from the National Autonomous University of Mexico, and a Ph.D. in astrophysics from the University of Manchester. Before joining ERIM, she worked at Leiden Observatory in The Netherlands as a researcher and support manager of the largest array of telescopes in the world, the Atacama Large Millimetre Array (ALMA). She is an expert on data management, open data, and public engagement.

# Expertise

```{r radarPlot}

member_name <- "Lizette Guzman Ramirez"
special_skill <- c("python", "dog lover")

OS_skills <- read_csv(here("static/OS_skills.csv")) %>%
  dplyr::filter(name %in% c("max", "min", member_name)) %>%
  dplyr::select(c("reproducible analysis", "open source software", all_of(special_skill), "data management", "open access", "data sharing", "preregistration"))

# custom radar plot
radarchart(OS_skills,
  axistype = 0, seg = 10,
  pcol = alpha("#002328", 0.8), pfcol = alpha("#00B969", 0.6), plwd = 4, centerzero = TRUE, # polygon
  cglcol = "#7e7e7e", axislabcol = "#002328", caxislabels = seq(0, 10, 2), cglwd = 0.8 # grid
)

```
